password.length: Password must be at least 8 characters.
password.message: Password must be at least 8 characters long and must contain a lower case letter, upper case letter, digit and a symbol.
password.match: Password and repeat password must match

login.min-length: Login must be at least 3 characters long.
login.max-length: Login must be at most 100 characters long.

email.max-length: Email address must be at most 320 characters long.

first-name.min-length: First name must be at least 1 character long.
first-name.max-length: First name must be at most 100 characters long.

last-name.min-length: Last name must be at least 1 character long.
last-name.max-length: Last name must be at most 100 characters long.

street.length: Street must be at most 85 characters long.

building.length: Building number must be greater than 0.

postal-code.length: Postal code must be 6 characters long.

city.min-length: City must be at least 2 characters long
city.max-length: City must be at most 85 characters long.
city.pattern: City must start with capital letter.

old-password.min-length: Old password must be longer than 8 characters

new-password.same-old: New password cannot be the same as old password

rate.length: Rate value must be greater or equal to 0.
rate.decimal-places: Rate value can have only up to 2 decimal places

effective-date.invalid-date: Effective date should be the first day of month

reading.length: Reading value must be greater than 0.
reading.decimal-places: Reading value can have only up to 3 decimal places

landing-page.title: Improve your community with eBok!
landing-page.description: The application aims to support the management of a residential community in the process of settling accounts for the units belonging to it. Each unit has an individual allocation of fee categories that are part of the settlement, and each category has a current rate and settlement principle. One of the main tasks of the system is to forecast the amount of future advances and assist the community manager in adjusting rates to minimize the difference between the projected costs incurred by unit owners and the actual costs incurred by the community.
